intro: Pachira condorensis, commonly known as the Cusco pachira, is a tropical plant native to the Peruvian Andes. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy roots and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows as an understory species in humid, shaded environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody fruits containing several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant.
